content.title: Breast Reduction Thailand- Bangkok and Samui
h2: WOULD YOU LIKE TO GET SURGEON FEEDBACK?
paragraphs: Women that have small breast often envy other women that have larger breast, however, what they don’t know is that women that have large breast suffer. Women that have breast that are too big often times suffer from issues like skin infections under the folds of the breast, have a difficult time breathing and suffer from back pain. None of these conditions are no picnic so many opt for surgery and consider breast reduction Thailand.

When the surgery is being preformed, skin and breast tissue and extra fat are eliminated and then the surgeon created smaller breast that’s just right for the woman’s body proportions. There are two ways in which breast reduction Thailandcan be done. One process involves a long scar or what is called and “anchor” scar is the method of choice for women with breast that are very large.

There is a cut made through the nipple, by the surgeon, and then behind the folds of the breast. Then the nipple is lifted and the breast are shaped. The second, process involves a smaller cut, which is for breast that are medium sized. The incision is made through the nipple only and through the fold as well. There are times when extra skin isn’t removed fully, which results in some folds of skin underneath the breast. However, not to worry, they normally, disappear within 3-5 months.

Of course, you have to keep in mind that every surgery comes with risk. The risk that are associated with breast implants include, difficulties in scar healing and wound infections. There may be a chance that there will be asymmetry where the nipple is positioned and might not be able to breast feed. All of these risk are important to consider when deciding on breast reduction Thailand.

After, the breast reduction there are some surgeons that prefer to apply an bra or and elastic bandage. Then there are some surgeons that will use drainage tubes to allow secretions and extra blood to drain. There’s a chance that you’ll experience pain when you make sharp movements or cough, and you’ll have the aid of pain killers to reduce the discomfort.

Within a few days, after the surgery you’ll be able to return to your every day activities, however, you should keep from doing anything strenuous for a month. After, breast reduction Thailandit’s suggested that you refrain from smoking since it can interfere with your healing process of the scars. It’s also recommended that for 1-2 weeks that you avoid sexual activity.

The scars and the bruises that result from the surgery, normally go away after a few weeks and six month after the surgery the final results can be noticed. The appearance of your breast, afterward, will be impacted by weight changes and any pregnancies. It’s also important to note that. Although, after breast reduction Thailandyour breast will be smaller, if you had back pain before it’s possible that you can still have pain, however, the pain will not worsen.

Fill out the Medical Questionnaire (next page) to help our plastic surgeon determine if you are medically qualified for your surgery. Surgeon will carefully review your case and prepare an initial evaluation, including a price quote for procedure(s).
Tell us what you are looking for and we will send you all the information…

( click to enlarge ) Nights in Hospital: 2-3 Duration of operation is about 4-6 hours and you need to stay in Thailand for atleast 12 days.
